oai_dc:dc.dc:title: First record of the invasive gecko, Lepidodactylus lugubris Duméril & Bibron, 1836 in mainland Chile (Squamata, Gekkonidae)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Urra, Felix
Zúñiga, Alejandro
Miranda-Calle, Alejandro Bruno
Melero, Nel
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Gekkonidae
invasion biology
invasive species
Squamata
Lepidodactylus lugubris
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In Chile, the presence of Mourning Gecko,Lepidodactylus lugubrisDuméril & Bibron, 1836 has been recognized for Easter Island (Rapa Nui) from late 19thcentury. Here, we report the first observation of a juvenile specimen ofL. lugubrisin an urban zone of Santiago, Región Metropolitana, mainland Chile, representing the southernmost non-insular record in America for this invasive species. Moreover, an updated distributional map ofL. lugubrisfor South America and the Antilles is provided.
